text: I have a huge fan of lasagna but
sometimes they're just a little too
heavy this zucchini ribbon lasagna is a
perfect way to lighten up a really
delicious nutritious dish so I'm start
by making a really hearty turkey sauce I
have my pan over medium heat adding
about two tablespoons of olive oil and
I've chopped up one medium onion so
we'll season this with a little bit of
salt red pepper flake you get the red
pepper flakes in early with the oil
it'll help season the dish throughout
because I really infuse the oil give it
a stir and wait for the onions to become
tender which will take about six minutes
or so onions are looking nice and tender
got a little caramelization on them
which is always great for flavor so to
this add 12 ounces of ground turkey meat
I'm using dark meat here because I like
that flavor you can also use white meat
and just break up the turkey using the
back of your spoon and just cook this
until the pinkness is no longer there
already smells amazing
looking great okay so look at the
tomatoes this is one 28-ounce can of
whole peeled tomatoes with their juices
and I just threw this in the blender
pureed it until it was smooth so we'll
turn this down so it's just simmering
gently let's add some chopped oregano to
this will add a really nice fresh
herbaceous flavor we're looking for
about two tablespoons chopped if you
don't have fresh oregano you can also
use a pinch of dried just definitely use
a little bit less of the dried varieties
because they tend to be a little bit
more potent so we'll lower this let this
simmer way and we want to let this meld
and become a little bit thicker it's
gonna take about 20 minutes so it's been
about 20 minutes my sauce has reduced
beautifully it's nice and thick tasty
just turn off the heat there we'll let
the sauce stand while we get our noodles
prepared I'm going to work on the
zucchini so start by just trimming the
tops off of two medium zucchini and then
thinly slice them we're looking for
about an eighth of an inch or so I like
using a mandolin you can also
use just a regular old sharps chef's
knife and very carefully slice
lengthwise instant noodles no need to
boil them you're getting all the extra
vitamins nutrients fiber of the zucchini
and really easy to prepare this is a
great way to get more vegetables into
your diet if you're looking to cut a few
carbs all vegetables all the time
gorgeous now it's time to assemble the
best part I have a 9 inch baking dish so
start by layering about 5 or 6 slices of
the zucchini in the bottom of the pan
I'm going to go for sort of the
stragglers here that don't look quite as
beautiful and you just want to overlap
them slightly here
about like so keep it a good seasoning
of salt and then we'll add about a cup
of sauce you can just kind of eyeball
this we're going to be using three
different layers with the sauce so if
it's easier to just look at your pan and
sort of divide it by thirds then dot
with ricotta I have one cup here and
we're going to use a quarter cup for
each layer so again just sort of eyeball
your amount that's good okay now for the
next layer we're going to change the
directions that we make sure we have
full coverage in the pan start by
layering your zucchini like so season
top with sauce and all up with cheese so
I'm using ricotta here if you wanted to
use a mozzarella that would be really
delicious as well
more zucchini will change the direction
once again season with salt now don't
worry if this seems sort of tall as it
cooks and the zucchini breaks down a
little bit it will sink very last of the
sauce here another great thing about
this dish is you can make a head the
sauce you can have a sauce you can even
slice up the zucchini so you can get
this assembled and ready to go for
dinner right after get home from work
final zucchini layer
okay season with salt after the top
layer I'm going to brush the ribbons
with a little bit of olive oil this is
just going to help make them caramelize
while they're baking give them really
really great flavor
Hey final ricotta so for the top here
I'm going to make some sort of larger
dogs just because they're pretty that
way all done so into the oven we go this
is going to bake it 375 uncovered for
about 50 to 60 minutes you want to see
bubbling and the zucchini should be nice
and browned on top okay so the lasagna
has set for about five to ten minutes
you don't want to cut into it right
after comes out of the oven because
it'll be blazing hot sprinkle with a

a little extra spice and some fresh

Irby flavor lovely
